title.narrative: DRR with Focus to School Safety

description.narrative:
Indus consortium (IC) is a network of three organization LHDP, Doaba Foundation and Help foundation and working in Sindh and Punjab. Currently, IC is implementing project with LHDP and help foundation in Sindh and Punjab province respectively. The project aims tomake #School Safer# through strengthening school based governance to reduced losses of lives, infrastructure and other educational assets from the vulnerable Communities in Disaster Prone Areas of Pakistan.
IC has conducted the researches andalso developed theiradvocacy strategy while building the capacity of the teachers, parents and students on DR and other related issues of disasters. Through their advocacy strategy IC is coordinate with the relevant stakeholders and also their agenda revolve around the constructionof safe building as schools and follow minimum prescribed safety guidelines as well improving the conditions of existing schools through development and implementation of DRR (risk reduction and management plans) developed bySchools Committees. Project interventions will focus on integrating DRR in education through curriculum infusion, structural and non structural improvements hence makingschools safer for local communities. Other impacts will include the capacitated school councils are managing their schools, increased enrollment and decreased drop out. Educational stake holders will come closer to each other through project interventions. IC currently working with the teachers in selected schools and also develops training manuals to fully equip teachers with knowledge, skills and behaviors required to deliver DRR education effectively. LHDP in district Badin and help foundation in district Ranjanpur singed MOU with the district Education department for the smooth implementation of the project.
Implementation of SC policy and compulsory primary education act will reinforce the whole change process in education sector. SC will be enabled to manage the schools andmaking duty bearers accountable for policy actions. Enriching curriculum with DRR and making schools infrastructure more disaster resilient will be the most important step towards making schools safer for communities. Safer schools to serve as safer relief camp will reduce the suffering of affected communities during disasters.
The Indus consortium is implementing their safer school project in district Badin and Ranjanpur with LHDP and Help Foundation respectively. Indus consortium is working in 40 schools in disaster prone areas to increase the resilience. The major activities of the project are capacity building of the teachers, awareness raising among teachers and children#s on DRR, advocacy with the government and construction/rehabilitation of missing facilities mainly the toilets of girl#s schools.

participating-org.narrative:
The Laar Humanitarian Development Programme has as mandate: disaster risk management and sustainable livelihoods initiatives. LHDP has worked on sustainable livelihood initiatives in the district of Badine, funded by the EU in partnership with Oxfam Novib.
LHDP is part of Oxfam International Consortium on DRR. This grant will help the partner to undertake urgently needed preparatory humanitarian work. The initial preparatory work will help to engage with the district government and to contribute fromthe inception of theresponse works.
